page.title: 16Oldmeldrum Employment
page.content: Traditionally Oldmeldrum is a market town in the farming area of the Garioch and has grown slowly over the last 300 years. Its major employers have been the Glengarioch distillery (whisky) and E J Paterson (builders). From a 1970s pop of 1000, Oldmeldrum has recently grown half as much again to a 1985 figure of 1580. Although some of these incoming householders are employed locally, such as at the agricultural machinery supplier, Sellars, or in local hotels, the majority of traditional jobs are held by long-standing locals, e.g. electricians, plumbers, slater, blacksmith, vehicle repairs, banks and catering. The incoming pop. therefore has found its employment, for women locally in the public sector and in shops, hotels and pubs, for men the main employment is oil-related work.
